thread.title: Turkish Airlines introduces Dammam flights to be operated from/to Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen International Airport
thread.title_full: Turkish Airlines introduces Dammam flights to be operated from/to Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen International Airport

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Turkish Airlines introduces Dammam flights to be operated from/to Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen International Airport
text:
Turkish Airlines introduces Dammam flights to be operated from/to Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen International Airport Turkish Airlines introduces Dammam flights to be operated from/to Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen International Airport Details Category: Airport & Airline   12:30 Turkish Airlines ranks among the world's major airlines thanks to its impressive growth figures and having the world's 4th largest flight network reaching 276 destinations in 110 countries. The airline continues to grow by offering new flight opportunities to its passengers. 
With existing services to Amsterdam, Baku, Berlin, Brussels, Dusseldorf, Northern Cyprus, Frankfurt, Kiev, Kuwait, London, Milano, Munich, Paris, Tbilisi, Tehran, Tel Aviv, Vienna, Rome, Stuttgart, Köln (Cologne) and Barcelona, Turkish Airlines now adds flights to Dammam as its 22th flight destination operated from/to Sabiha Gökçen International Airport. This will offer a great travel alternative not only for those who want to reach Istanbul, but also for Saudi Arabian travellers who wish to reach destinations both in Turkey and beyond. Beginning from today, Dammam flights from/to Sabiha Gökçen International Airport will be operated seven times per week in both directions. Related articles
